column3: the owner/chef pay too much attention to the presentation or form of the cuisine than the food itself. The seasoning for most dishes are way too salty (wakyu on hot rock
column5: eel tempura was poorly handled to the freshwater fishy smell
column7: apple slice and sweet potato chips) is a lost balance combination. Hamachi chili could be a worth try. Also ordered "Hanna to Yuzu" grilled cauliflower with Yuzu sauce
column8: it must have been wait on counter too long to keep the cauliflower in shape
column9: and leave a bitterness taste. Luckily
column10: bar chef tried hard to keep us entertained with the crews
column11: that gives the two stars. Long way to go...
